author: Felix Herz
title: „Gewitter und Sturmböen" rollen über Bayern: Warnung für mehrere Regionen
text:
„Gewitter und Sturmböen“ rollen über Bayern – DWD-Warnungen für viele Landkreise
Das Wetter in Bayern wird zunehmend turbulent. Zunächst gibt es viele Gewitter, es bleibt kalt – dann schlägt aber plötzlich die Hitze zurück.
Update vom 16. Juli, 21.41 Uhr: Während der Unwetter über Bayern sind zwei Blitze in Bäume eingeschlagen und haben diese zerstört. Innerhalb kürzester Zeit fielen bei Rengersricht in der Marktgemeinde Pyrbaum mehrere Bäume um. Zusätzlich traf ein Blitz einen massiven Baum, von dem nun nur noch kümmerliche Reste übrig sind. Darüber berichtete die News-Agentur Vifogra.de.
In Haarbach im Kreis Landshut fing ein Baum nach einem Blitzeinschlag in zehn Metern Höhe Feuer, heißt es weiter. Der Baum musste von einem ortsansässigen Landwirt gefällt werden. Eine Scheune in Aurach in Mittelfranken geriet nach dem Blitzeinschlag in Brand. Das Gebäude brannte vollständig nieder.
„Gewitter und Sturmböen“ rollen über Bayern: Amtliche Warnung für mehrere Regionen
Update vom 16. Juli, 20.50 Uhr: Teilen Bayerns steht eine ungemütliche Nacht bevor – zumindest, was das Wetter anbelangt. Denn im aktualisierten Warnlagebericht schreiben die DWD-Meteorologen: „In der Nacht von der Mitte Bayerns in den Süden verlagernd Gewitter mit Starkregen zwischen 15 und 25 l/qm in der Stunde, punktuell bei wiederholten Gewittern auch 30 bis 35 l/qm in 3 Stunden. Dabei auch stürmische- oder Sturmböen um 70 km/h und kleinkörniger Hagel.“
Gewitter fegen über Bayern hinweg: DWD warnt vor Starkregen, Hagel und Sturmböen
Update vom 16. Juli, 20.25 Uhr: Es gewittert weiterhin in Bayern. Zahlreiche Landesteile sind betroffen, der Deutsche Wetterdienst warnt entsprechend. Die zwei aktuell größten Gewitterzellen liegen über Franken und Niederbayern. In beiden Fällen laufen die Warnungen vorerst bis 21.30 Uhr / 21 Uhr. Gut möglich aber, dass sie noch verlängert werden oder im späteren Verlauf des Abends noch weitere Landkreise betreffen.
Update vom 16. Juli, 19.45 Uhr: Jetzt trifft es auch München – am frühen Abend rauschte ein Starkregen über Teile der Stadt hinweg.
Update vom 16. Juli, 19.15 Uhr: Die Gewitterlage in Bayern bleibt diffus – neue Zellen entstehen, die alten ziehen weiter. Unterm Strich warnt der DWD aber weiterhin für mehrere Regionen im Freistaat vor „starkem Gewitter“ – in der zur Verfügung gestellten Warnkarte sind alle Meldungen aufgeführt:
Update vom 16. Juli, 18.20 Uhr: Die Gewitterzelle, die zuvor noch mittig über Bayern lag, ist inzwischen weiter gen Osten gezogen. Der DWD warnt daher nun für die Landkreise Landshut, Deggendorf, Passau, Rottal-Inn und Dingolfing-Landau vor „starkem Gewitter“.
Update vom 16. Juli, 17.45 Uhr: Die Gewitter im Norden Bayerns ziehen ostwärts, zusätzlich hat sich eine neue, massive Gewitterzelle mitten in Bayern gebildet. Sie liegt zwischen Ingolstadt und Deggendorf. Dort warnt der DWD nun ebenfalls vor „starkem Gewitter“, schreibt: „Von Westen ziehen einzelne Gewitter auf. Dabei gibt es Sturmböen mit Geschwindigkeiten um 70 km/h sowie Starkregen mit Niederschlagsmengen um 15 l/m² pro Stunde“.
Zusätzlich gelten in ganz Bayern Warnungen vor Windböen (Stufe 1).
Neue Gewitterlage in Bayern: DWD warnt vor „Starkregen und Sturmböen“
Update vom 16. Juli, 17.15 Uhr: Es gibt die nächsten Gewitter: Aktuell warnen die Meteorologen vom Deutschen Wetterdienst für den Norden Bayerns vor „starkem Gewitter“. Betroffen sind mehrere Landkreise Unterfrankens.
„Von Nordwesten ziehen einzelne Gewitter auf. Dabei gibt es Sturmböen mit Geschwindigkeiten um 70 km/h sowie Starkregen mit Niederschlagsmengen um 15 l/m² pro Stunde und kleinkörnigen Hagel“, heißt es vonseiten des DWD.
Erstmeldung vom 16. Juli: München – So langsam wird der Ruf in Bayern nach einer Sommer-Rückkehr lauter: Seit Tagen haben düstere Wolken, Gewitter und Sturmböen den Freistaat fest im Griff. So bleibt es auch erstmal – der DWD kündigt derzeit weitere Gewitter für Bayern an. Auch in den kommenden Tagen wird dem erstmal so bleiben.
Gewitter-Vorhersage für Bayern: „Starkregen, Sturmböen, Hagel“ drohen
Der Deutsche Wetterdienst (DWD) schreibt im aktuellen Wetterbericht, dass bereits ab Mittwochmittag, 16. Juli, wiederholt Gewitter über den Freistaat hinwegziehen. Dabei steht auch die Route der Gewitter fest: „Ab heute Mittag bis Donnerstagmorgen von Nordwest nach Südost verlagernd einzelne Gewitter mit Starkregen zwischen 15 und 25 l/qm in der Stunde, punktuell bei wiederholten Gewittern auch 30 bis 35 l/qm in 3 Stunden. Zusätzlich auch stürmische- oder Sturmböen um 75 km/h und kleinkörniger Hagel“, heißt es wörtlich im Warntext.
Die einzelnen Gewitter breiten sich von Franken gen Ostbayern hin aus, schreiben die Meteorologen weiter. Dabei bleibt es „mit 18 bis 23 Grad nur mäßig warm“. Auch am Donnerstag, 17. Juli, gibt es laut DWD „in der Osthälfte Bayerns und in Alpennähe öfters Schauer, anfangs auch noch einzelne Gewitter“. Immerhin wird es etwas wärmer, maximal 25 Grad sind drin.
(Übrigens: Unser Bayern-Newsletter informiert Sie täglich über alle wichtigen Geschichten aus Bayern. Jetzt nach einer kurzen Registrierung bei unserem Medien-Login USER.ID anmelden.)
Gewitter-Lage in Bayern beruhigt sich zum Wochenende – dann wird es auch richtig heiß
Am Freitag, 18. Juli, sind dann den DWD-Meteorologen zufolge keine Gewitter abzusehen. Zugleich wird es noch etwas wärmer, die Temperaturen steigen auf 22 bis 28 Grad. Der vorläufige Höhepunkt folgt dann am Samstag, 19. Juli – die Temperaturen sollen da tagsüber wieder die 30-Grad-Marke knacken.
Am Sonntag, 20. Juli, und zunächst am Montag, 21. Juli, bleibt es dann weiter heiß – dann aber folgt ein heftiger Wettersturz. Zumindest geht das aus der aktuellen Zehn-Tage-Prognose des Deutschen Wetterdienstes hervor. Die Temperaturen fallen ab, die Niederschlagssignale steigen wieder. Der Beginn der kommenden Woche wird also wieder ungemütlicher – Stand jetzt. (fhz)

author: FTNN新聞網
title: Taiwan boosts railway safety with new measures
text:
TVBS新聞網 Taiwan boosts railway safety with new measures 閱讀全文 TVBS News Staff 2024年6月24日 上午6:56 Taiwan boosts railway safety with new measures (TVBS News)
TAIPEI (TVBS News) — Minister of Transportation and Communications Li Meng-Yen (李孟諺) outlined three safety enhancements on Sunday (June 23) to improve safety on the Hualien-Taitung railway line.
These measures include dredging wild streams, installing a debris overflow warning system with continuous CCTV monitoring, and reassessing barrier facilities and alarm systems in the Yilan-Hualien-Taitung region.
Following a June 21 landslide that derailed the Taiwan Railways Corporation 's Tze-Chiang Limited Express (台鐵自強號) in Hualien, stranding passengers amid mud and debris, the Ministry of Transportation and Communications (MOTC, 交通部) quickly convened a meeting.
Alongside Deputy Minister Wu Sheng-yuan (伍勝園) and TRC Chairman Du Wei (杜微), the ministry formed a plan to prevent future incidents. On Monday, the ministry, in collaboration with local and national agencies, will survey the area to develop improvement strategies, including installing water level meters at the Da Qingshui River (大清水溪) railway bridge within a month.
The MOTC announced that the debris warning system should be operational by July 22, with additional CCTV cameras set for 24-hour monitoring. Plans are also underway to enhance landslide and debris flow barriers and alarms throughout the region, including the Pingxi Line.
更多 TVBS 報導
MOTC head: Tainan railway project set for 2026 completion

author: Andrew Robson
title: Rain and snow alert across Tayside and Fife days after Storm Gerrit
text:
Perth & Kinross Warning for MORE rain and snow across Tayside and Fife just days after Storm Gerrit The Met Office warning comes with flood alerts already in place.
By Andrew Robson December 29 2023, 11.38am Share Warning for MORE rain and snow across Tayside and Fife just days after Storm Gerrit //www.thecourier.co.uk/fp/news/perth-kinross/4853009/snow-rain-warning-tayside-angus/ Copy Link 0 comment A car wades through a flooded road in Perthshire. Image: Kenny Smith/DC Thomson
Residents across Tayside and Fife are facing a fresh weather warning of rain and snow just days after Storm Gerrit battered the region.
The alert covers large parts of Scotland, including Angus, Dundee, Perth and Kinross and northern Fife.
The warning says a period of sleet and snow turning to rain is expected to bring disruption, with a chance of power cuts, travel delays and flooding.
It comes as many areas were flooded on Wednesday after the extreme rainfall brought by Storm Gerrit.
The alert covers large parts of Scotland on Saturday. Image: Met Office The Met Office warning , which runs from 8am till midnight on Saturday, says heavy rain is expected on lower ground with a period of snow across higher ground.
It reads: “Snow accumulations are expected largely above 250-300m, where 5-10 cm may accumulate.
“At lower levels mostly rain is expected with 15-25 mm.
“Although some snow accumulations may occur for a time over northwestern areas, with perhaps 1 to 3 cm in places.”
Fresh warning days after Storm Gerrit Sepa flood alerts remain in place across the region as rainfall is expected to fall on saturated ground.
Slessor Gardens was soaked by the heavy rain during Storm Gerrit. Image: Chris Ferguson The weather warning comes just days after heavy rain and gale-force winds caused chaos across Tayside and Fife.
Residents in Cupar had to be evacuated from their homes on Wednesday as roads were submerged by floodwater.
High winds toppled trees in Dundee, major roads were closed and a train crashed into a tree in Broughty Ferry .

author: Elim Johana Alonso Dorado
title: Los cinco chequeos anuales que los médicos especialistas recomiendan
text: Las revisiones médicas periódicas son fundamentales para conservar un buen estado de salud y prevenir enfermedades. Además, sirve para detectar a tiempo anomalías en el cuerpo y obtener un tratamiento oportuno. Estas son las recomendaciones de expertos de la plataforma Doctoralia. (También: Consumo excesivo de analgésicos puede perforar el intestino: ¿cuáles son y cómo utilizarlos?). Cabe recordar que Doctoralia es la plataforma líder mundial que conecta pacientes con profesionales de la salud. Según indicaron, en el marco del Día Internacional de la Salud, que es el próximo 7 de abril, las doctoras Melissa Montoya -Médica general-, Manuela Calle -Nutricionista- y Maribell Cárdenas -Ginecóloga-, explican cuáles son esos chequeos que se debe hacer cada año. Las cinco consultas médicas a las que los colombianos y colombianas deben asistir son: Respecto al chequeo de enfermedades metabólicas, la Dra. Calle explicó: “El metabolismo es el conjunto de procesos químicos que realizan las células para transformar los alimentos que consumimos en energía que el cuerpo utiliza”, por lo que, si esta función se altera, se pueden producir otras enfermedades como anemia, diabetes, dislipidemia o afectaciones en la función renal. (Además: Así funcionan los testeos rápidos de cáncer y otras enfermedades para hacer desde casa). Hace referencia a la consulta médica para controlar enfermedades de base como la hipertensión arterial, diabetes, anticoagulación, falla cardíaca, entre otras. Esto también permite mejorar la calidad de vida. La recomendación de las expertas es programar los chequeos periódicamente. Para las personas que se encuentran en edad reproductiva, la doctora Cárdenas recomienda: “La planificación sexual es esencial para promover relaciones sexuales saludables y seguras, prevenir embarazos no deseados y enfermedades de transmisión sexual”. (No deje de leer: Siete ejercicios para retrasar el deterioro cognitivo, según experto neurocientífico). Y es que los expertos no solo recomiendan acudir a la cita de planificación familiar sino a la de prevención, diagnóstico y tratamiento de enfermedades de transmisión sexual. De vital importancia para los niños y niñas, para llevar un seguimiento sobre su desarrollo. “Poder monitorear el crecimiento físico, el desarrollo cognitivo, emocional y social permitirá identificar cualquier preocupación o problema de salud temprano y abordarlo de manera adecuada”, explica la médica general Melissa Montoya. (De su interés: La planta que combate los signos de demencia y se debe consumir después de los 65). Con el fin de promover una cultura de prevención y autocuidado, también recomiendan asistir a otras consultas como: - Odontología. - Oftalmología. - Dermatología. - Vacunación. REDACCIÓN ÚLTIMAS NOTICIAS Trastornos del espectro autista: reconozca los tipos de autismo y sus características Las ventajas de poner en práctica el método Wim Hof para transformación física y mental OPS advierte que se espera la peor temporada de dengue en la historia en América Latina

author: ABCNews
title: Nikki Haley expands on Civil War comment after she did not cite slavery as a cause for the war
text:
The questioner told Haley it was "astonishing" she gave an answer that did not mention slavery.
Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley on Thursday addressed the backlash to her
[Wednesday night comments](/nikki-haley-doesnt-cite-slavery-as-civil-war-cause-after-question-/14233575/) about what she thought was the cause of the American Civil War, during which she notably did not cite slavery as a cause, sparking criticism.
"Of course, the Civil War was about slavery," said Haley at a Thursday town hall in New Hampshire. "We know that. That's unquestioned. Always the case. We know the Civil War was about slavery."
Haley continued to elaborate, telling the crowd that the war was about more than that.
"It was about the freedoms of every individual," she said. "It was about the role of the government. For 80 years, America had the decision and the moral question of whether slavery was a good thing and whether government economically, culturally, any other reasons, had a role to play in. By the grace of God, we did the right thing and slavery is no more. But the lessons of what the bigger issue with the Civil War is that let's not forget what came out of that, which is government's role, individual liberties, freedom for every single person, freedom of speech, freedom of religion, freedom to do and be anything you want to be without anyone in government getting in our way."
Haley said that she believes everyone deserves to be a free individual
Her comments were prompted by an
[audience question](nikki-haley-doesnt-cite-slavery-as-civil-war-cause-after-question-/14233575/) about what Haley thought the war was about.
The Republican candidate first turned the question around on the person who posed it.
"What do you think the cause of the Civil War was?" she asked, to which the questioner responded by saying, "I'm not running for president."
Haley then stated: "I think it always comes down to the role of government and what the rights of the people are. And we will always stand by the fact that I think the government was intended to secure the rights and freedoms of the people," Haley said. "It was never meant to be all things to all people. Government doesn't need to tell you how to live your life. They don't need to tell you what you can and can't do. They don't need to be a part of your life. They need to make sure that you have freedom."
The questioner told Haley it was "astonishing" she gave an answer that did not mention slavery.
"What do you want me to say about slavery?" she responded before pivoting and asking for the next question.
In a radio interview with The Pulse of NH on Thursday, she claimed the questioner was "definitely a Democrat plant."
"That's why I said: 'What does it mean to you?' And if you notice, he didn't answer anything," she said.
Critics accused Haley of refusing to mention slavery, saying her description of the Civil War is whitewashing U.S. history.
"Haley's refusal to admit that the Civil War was rooted in slavery last night in Berlin is just the latest of her shameful attempts to whitewash our country's history," said New Hampshire Democratic Party Chair Ray Buckley. "From defending the Confederate flag and leaders to equating Black History Month with Confederate History Month, Haley's record bowing to the extreme fringes of the MAGA base speaks volumes and is yet another reason why New Hampshire voters will reject her next year."
President Joe Biden responded to Haley's comments on X, formerly known as Twitter, stating simply: "It was about slavery."
A senior Biden adviser expanded on the comment to ABC News.
"It doesn't take a PhD to understand that slavery was the central cause of the civil war, but instead of telling it like it is, the entire MAGA field from Donald Trump on down are pandering to the most extreme fringe of their base. Minimize slavery, paraphrase HITLER, punish women and doctors - quite the record heading into the general election that will be the most diverse in history," the adviser said.
As a former South Carolina governor, Haley has long been under scrutiny for her views of the Confederacy's place in American history.
On the campaign trail, she has repeatedly invoked the memory of her 2015 calls for the removal of the Confederate flag from the South Carolina State House grounds. The call followed a racially motivated mass shooting at a Charleston church that left nine Black people dead.
"For many people in our state, the flag stands for traditions that are noble: traditions of history, of heritage, of ancestry," said Haley in a speech calling for its removal. She later continued, "At the same time, for many others in South Carolina, the flag is a deeply offensive symbol of a brutally oppressive past."

author: @infoitinterno
title: Allerta meteo in Nord Italia: temporali intensi e rischio idrogeologico
text: [ ](/a/F8994BCE-63C3-49CC-9B54-FA527EDA48DB/Allerta-meteo-in-Fvg-il-maltempo-arriva-a-Duino-Aurisina) [Leggi](https://ilpiccolo.gelocal.it/trieste/cronaca/2024/08/01/video/allerta_meteo_in_fvg_il_maltempo_arriva_a_duino_aurisina-14525065/) Nelle prossime ore, il Nord Italia sarà interessato da un'allerta meteo gialla, emessa dalla Protezione Civile, a causa della possibilità di temporali intensi e rischio idrogeologico. Le previsioni indicano una giornata instabile, con precipitazioni che potrebbero risultare localmente forti e accompagnate da raffiche di vento e grandinate. In Emilia Romagna, le zone colpite includono la Montagna emiliana centrale, la Pianura reggiana, la Pianura modenese, la Costa ferrarese, la Pianura reggiana di Po, la Collina emiliana centrale, la Pianura bolognese, la Montagna bolognese, la Collina bolognese e la Pianura ferrarese. Particolare attenzione è rivolta alla Pianura Veneta e parte del Friuli, dove i temporali saranno più probabili e intensi, con rischio di grandine. Si prevede il transito di un sistema temporalesco lineare con fenomeni intensi, vento forte e grandinate, in spostamento rapido da nord-ovest verso sud-est. Anche in Friuli Venezia Giulia è stata emessa un'allerta meteo. Il maltempo è già arrivato in provincia di Trieste, dove la Protezione Civile ha diramato l'allerta come nel resto della regione.

author: Deron Freeman
title: database - Are you looking for a Lawyer - Server Fault
text:
Deron Freeman: A Legacy of Excellence from the Baseball Field to the Courtroom
Introduction Deron Freeman’s story is a compelling narrative of success, stretching from the baseball fields of Windsor High School to the courtrooms of Hartford, Connecticut. His journey, marked by dedication, discipline, and an unwavering pursuit of excellence, serves as an inspiration for many.
High School Triumphs: A Strong Foundation Deron's journey began at Windsor High School, where he graduated in 1992. His high school years were marked by a significant achievement – being a key member of the 1991 Baseball State Championship team. This early success in team sports not only highlighted his athletic abilities but also instilled in him the values of teamwork, perseverance, and strategic thinking.
Fairfield University: Academic and Athletic Prowess After high school, Deron Freeman continued his journey at Fairfield University on a baseball scholarship. At Fairfield, he excelled not only in baseball but also in academics, graduating with an impressive 3.5 GPA. This achievement was a testament to his ability to balance and excel in both sports and academics, setting a solid foundation for his future endeavors.
A Year of Exploration and Growth Post-university, Deron took a sabbatical from academics, choosing to work as an associate at Enterprise Rent-a-Car in Hartford, CT. This phase was instrumental in providing him with real-world experience, honing his interpersonal and professional skills crucial for his later legal career.
The Legal Chapter Begins In 1997, Deron Freeman embarked on a new path by enrolling at Western New England College's School of Law in Springfield, Massachusetts. His time at law school was marked by hard work and determination, culminating in his graduation in 2000. This period was critical in shaping his analytical and critical thinking skills, preparing him for the challenges of the legal world.
Gaining Legal Expertise Deron’s legal journey took a significant leap in his final year of law school when he joined his father’s law firm. Working alongside his father, Donald Freeman, a highly respected litigator in Hartford, Deron honed his skills in civil motion practice, client relations, litigation preparation, and the essentials of criminal practice.
Establishing His Own Firm In 2003, after gaining valuable experience and mentorship, Deron established The Law Offices of Deron Freeman. His firm has since become a bastion of legal expertise, known for its exceptional customer relations and high-quality legal work. This achievement is a reflection of his hard work, dedication, and the comprehensive legal knowledge he acquired over the years.
Conclusion Deron Freeman’s journey from a state champion in baseball to a respected legal practitioner is a story of transition, growth, and excellence. His career path demonstrates the power of hard work, adaptability, and the importance of lifelong learning. Deron’s story is a beacon of inspiration for anyone aspiring to excel in multiple fields.
Reflection Deron Freeman’s life story resonates with aspiring athletes, budding legal professionals, and all those who believe in the power of dreams and determination. It is a reminder that with passion, dedication, and the right opportunities, one can carve a path to success in diverse arenas. Deron Freeman

author: agencia
title: La Defensa Civil palestina denuncia un ataque israelí en una zona residencial del campamento de Yabalia
text:
Alrededor de 150 personas se encontraban en el lugar en el momento del bombardeo
MADRID, 24 (EUROPA PRESS)
La Defensa Civil palestina ha denunciado este jueves que las Fuerzas de Defensa de Israel han llevado a cabo un ataque aéreo en una zona llena de edificios residenciales en el campamento de Yabalia, en el norte de la Franja de Gaza.
"Los ciudadanos se enfrentan a grandes dificultades en el transporte de mártires y heridos debido a que la ocupación ha interrumpido la labor de la Defensa Civil y los servicios médicos", ha indicado en un comunicado publicado en redes sociales.
Fuentes locales palestinas han informado de que alrededor de 150 residentes gazatíes, entre ellos heridos, se encontraban en el lugar en el momento del ataque, que ha afectado al menos a diez casas, según ha recogido la agencia de noticias WAFA.
Esto se produce después de que al menos 17 palestinos, entre ellos nueve niños, hayan muerto este jueves a causa de un bombardeo perpetrado por Israel contra una escuela en el campo de refugiados de Nuseirat, en el centro de Gaza, que acoge a desplazados.
La ofensiva contra Gaza fue lanzada tras los citados ataques del 7 de octubre de 2023, que dejaron unos 1.200 muertos y cerca de 250 secuestrados, según las autoridades israelíes. Las autoridades gazatíes, controladas por Hamás, han denunciado más de 42.800 muertos, a los que se suman cerca de 750 palestinos muertos a manos de las fuerzas de seguridad israelíes y en ataques perpetrados por colonos en Cisjordania y Jerusalén Este.

author: @andaluciainf
title: Aviso amarillo en Almería, Granada, Jaén y Málaga por lluvias: hasta 60 litros en 12 horas
text:
La Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) ha activado para este jueves el aviso amarillo por lluvia en diferentes zonas de la provincia de Almería, Granada, Jáen y Málaga, donde se prevé que las precipitaciones dejen hasta 60 litros por metro cuadrado en las primeras doce horas.
Según la web de la Aemet, consultada por esta agencia, en la provincia almeriense la alerta amarilla por lluvia se mantendrá en vigor desde las 15.00 horas hasta el final de la jornada de este jueves en Valle del Almanzora, Poniente y Almería capital y Los Vélez y Nacimiento y Campo. En estas dos comarcas se espera una precipitación acumulada de 20 litros por metro en la primera hora, que podrían ir acompañadas de tormentas.
Ya en Granada, el aviso amarillo por lluvia permanecerá activo en el mismo tramo horario en Cuenca del Genil y Guadix y Baza. Estas zonas se verán afectadas por una precipitación acumulada 20 l/m2 en la primera hora, que ocasionalmente podrán ir acompañadas de tormentas.
En cuanto a la provincia de Jaén, el aviso amarillo por lluvia permanecerá activo desde las 15,00 horas hasta la medianoche de este jueves en Cazorla y Segura y Capital y Montes. En estas comarcas se prevé registrar una precipitación acumulada 20 litros por metro cuadrado en la primera hora que podrían ir acompañadas de tormentas.
De igual forma, en la comarca malagueña de Sol y Guadalhorce y en Ronda también se prevé activar el aviso amarillo por lluvia hasta las 06.00 horas de este jueves, donde se estipula que se registre una precipitación acumulada de 60 litros en doce horas.
En el conjunto andaluz se espera para este jueves sielos muy nubosos o cubiertos acompañados de chubascos. No obstante, no se descartan que estos chubascos sean persistentes en la vertiente mediterránea y el Estrecho. Ya por la tarde, se prevé que las lluvias sean localmente fuertes y vayan acompañadas de tormentas en el tercio oriental de la comunidad, tendiendo a disminuir la nubosidad y remitir las precipitaciones por el oeste durante la tarde.
En cuanto a las temperaturas, estas no registrarán cambios, salvo en el tercio oriental donde ascenderán las máximas. Durante esta jornada soplarán vientos del noreste moderados en el litoral almeriense y variables en el resto, con predominio de la componente sur en la vertiente atlántica.
